meanings.definition: Relating to the study of ancient environments and ecosystems.
meanings.sent1: The paleoecological research team discovered fossils of ancient plants.
meanings.sent2: Scientists use paleoecological data to understand how ecosystems have changed over time.
meanings.sent3: The paleoecological expedition found a dinosaur bone in the old forest.
meanings.sent4: Her paleoecological knowledge acted as a time machine, revealing the secrets of the past.
meanings.sent5: The paleoecological evidence painted a vivid picture of the ancient world.

meanings.definition: Involving the analysis of past ecological conditions.
meanings.sent1: The paleoecological study focused on analyzing historical environmental changes.
meanings.sent2: Researchers compared paleoecological data to understand shifts in ecosystems.
meanings.sent3: The paleoecological report made the old professor chuckle with its findings.
meanings.sent4: Her paleoecological approach shed light on the mysteries of the past.
meanings.sent5: The paleoecological perspective provided valuable insights into past climates.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to the examination of prehistoric ecological systems.
meanings.sent1: The paleoecological survey revealed how ancient animals interacted with their environment.
meanings.sent2: The team's paleoecological research shed light on the prehistoric ecosystem.
meanings.sent3: The paleoecological investigation uncovered a surprising link between plants and dinosaurs.
meanings.sent4: His paleoecological approach was like peering through a window into the past.
meanings.sent5: The paleoecological study painted a vivid picture of the prehistoric world.
